title: Everything you need to know about learning to scuba dive
text:
Ask any diver about the ocean and they'll likely shower you with tales of their subaquatic adventures – the trepidation of that first breath underwater, the thrill of catching a current, the adrenaline of sinking into murky unknown depths – because scuba diving is one of the few things that can be exciting, relaxing and terrifically scary all at the same time, and there's always something to talk about.

Learning the sport is just like getting your driver's licence – there are age limits, safety briefs, a theory test and practical tasks. Some people pick it up straight away while for others, it takes a bit longer. The sense of achievement you get when you finally pass your performance-based training...
